critique: This executive order aims to increase the participation of historically Black colleges and universities in Federally sponsored programs. It directs executive agencies to identify and eliminate barriers that may have unfairly reduced their participation. It promotes social inclusion and aims to overcome discriminatory treatment. It also centralizes authority in the federal government to achieve these goals. There is moderate intervention in the economy to achieve social goals. There is no impact on immigration, executive power, or national security vs. civil liberties. Therefore, the initial scores are as follows:
